title: ['Limantour Beach Accessible Parking Lot will be closed until further notice']
description: ['The Limantour Beach Accessible Parking Lot Road will be closed until further notice as new vault toilets are installed. The main parking lot & the path to the beach remain open.']

title: ['Road Construction Projects']
description: ['Parkway areas closed for ongoing road maintenance and construction projects.']

title: ['Flooding Impacts on Spring Creek Road', 'Cave Mountain Road Temporary Closure', 'South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available', 'Spring Creek Landing Closed to Vehicle-Assisted Launches']
description: ['Heavy rainfall and flooding have washed out Spring Creek Road causing poor road conditions. Road access has been closed at the park boundary. Please exercise caution if traveling around the park.', 'Newton County Road 5, also known as Cave Mountain Road, will be closed Mondays - Thursdays from 8am - 4pm for road improvements. The road will be open Fridays - Sundays to all traffic.', 'In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.', 'The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.']

title: ['Prescribed Fire - Good Harbor Bay Area', 'Pierce Stocking Scenic Drive Winter & Spring Vehicle Road Closure']
description: ['The Lakeshore anticipates the Good Harbor Bay Trail and portions of Lake Michigan Road (north) to be closed Thursday, April 17 for prescribed fire operations. Good Harbor Bay Trail will remain closed until fire operations are complete.', 'This road is closed to vehicles. It remains open to foot traffic. The seasonal reopening date is determined by the amount of sand, hazard trees, and debris that will need to be cleaned up or moved after winter storms. This is typically in mid-May.']

title: ['Fort Hunt Loop Road temporarily closed to vehicles', 'Fort Hunt Ramp Closure']
description: ['The Fort Hunt Loop Road is temporarily closed to vehicles between Picnic Areas B and C due to maintenance work on a water leak. Pedestrians and bicyclists are able to move around the work zone marked with barrels and cones.', 'Due to a water main break, the ramp from N/B GW Parkway to Fort Hunt, as well as the access road from Fort Hunt to N/B GW Parkway, is closed. Fort Hunt is still accessible from the S/B side of the parkway.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Fort Hunt Loop Road temporarily closed to vehicles', 'id': 'CB432D0F-A09D-4C1E-A483-199F6B3C455E', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/gwmp/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], []]

title: ['River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice']
description: ['The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.']

title: ['Guadalupe Mountains National Park Moves to “High” Fire Danger Rating', 'Williams Ranch Road Closed', "Devil's Hall is a Strenuous Hike"]
description: ['In addition to park fire regulations: . Smoking limited to inside a vehicle. · No open fires (this includes wood, charcoal and/or gas fire pits) are permitted anywhere in the park. · Use of gas canister stoves for cooking are still allowed at this time', 'The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.', "The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. The portion of the route in the wash requires rock scrambling and is dangerous when wet or if water is present. The wash surface is loose gravel and rocks and may be unstable."]

park: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park
title: ['North Rim spring opening delayed', 'South Rim Road construction continuing in 2025']
description: ['Due to a delay in contracting for road maintenance, North Rim Road is estimated to open by mid-May. Until then, all North Rim facilities will remain closed, and the road will remain closed and gated at the park boundary.', 'Road improvement projects will continue in 2025. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'North Rim Winter Closure', 'id': '5AFC5EF9-5A99-47D7-B438-01DBF0FB9A46', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blca/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'South Rim Road Construction', 'id': '75883C21-B99F-44AB-A551-DDBAD3306156', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/blca/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

park: Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument
title: ['Loop Road and North Entrance Seasonal Closures']
description: ['The Loop Road and North Entrance are closed to motorized vehicles for the winter starting 11/4. These areas are accessible by foot, bike, ski, and snowshoe. Restrooms and campsites are accessible but not maintained in the off-season. Learn more below.']

title: ['Icy Roads - Please Use Caution!', 'North Entrance Road and Rim Drive are CLOSED for the season.']
description: ['The open roads in the park have lots of icy patches. Please drive slowly and with caution. All Oregon Chain Laws apply.', 'The North Entrance Road and East & West Rim Drives are now closed for the season a few The roads will not open again until mid to late June or July 2025. All other roads are open.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[], [{'title': 'Seasonal Closure of North Entrance Road and Rim Drive', 'id': '60D26BCB-B47D-4B38-8562-EF54ACF41B59', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/crla/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['West and East Border Roads closed for public safety', 'Gachado Line Camp open. Southeast border road and access roads closed', 'Pozo Nuevo Road to Bates Well Ranch High Clearance, 4-Wheel Drive Only']
description: ['The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. South Puerto Blanco Drive remains open.', 'El Camino De Dos Republicas remains open from SR85 to Gachado Line Camp. Dos Lomitas is not accessible. The southeast border road from Lukeville Port of Entry eastward to the Santa Rosa Mountains is closed to public vehicle and pedestrian traffic.', 'High Clearance, 4-wheel drive is required from where Pozo Nuevo Road begins along South Puerto Blanch Drive to Bates Well Ranch area. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.']

title: ['Cosby Entrance Road closed for construction', 'Most visitors need a parking tag']
description: ['Rehabilitation began on December 9 for the 2.3-mile-long Cosby Entrance Road from TN State Route 32 to the gate of Cosby Campground. While crews are working, the entrance road is closed to the public. The work is projected to be completed in spring 2025.', 'All vehicles parking for longer than 15 minutes require a parking tag. Three tag durations are available for purchase for all vehicle sizes and types: Daily ($5), Weekly ($15), or Annual ($40).']

title: ['Please park legally and responsibly in Zion National Park and the Town of Springdale']
description: ['Zion has limited parking space. Park only in designated stalls. Vehicles parked outside of designated stalls are subject to citation and may be towed. Once all designated parking stalls in Zion are full, visitors should park in Springdale.']

title: ['Tioga Road (Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed for the winter']
description: ['Tioga Road (continuation of Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed for the season due to snow. They usually open around late May or June. Call 209/372-0200 (then 1, 1) for road conditions and tire chain requirements.']

park: Selma to Montgomery National Historic Trail
title: ['Temporary Location - Selma Welcome Center']
description: ['Due to the closure of the Selma Interpretive Center, the Selma Welcome Center at 14 Broad Street has trail staff to provide visitor information services.']

title: ['Temporary Blackland Prairie Trail Closure to Equestrians']
description: ['Heavy rain has undermined a culvert making it unsafe for passage. Due to horse trailer parking availability, the entire section is closed to equestrians. Hikers are still able to travel from the railroad tracks to the Parkway Visitor Center.']

title: ['Major Road Closure in Corinth, Mississippi, due to Bridge Replacement']
description: ['A major bridge replacement has begun on North Polk Street in Corinth. Motorists will need to seek other routes. Please use link for a map and directions from Shiloh Battlefield to the Corinth Civil War Center.']

title: ['Government Wash closure to vehicle access and overnight camping']
description: ['Government Wash Road and 8.0 Mile Road will be blocked, and motor vehicle access and overnight camping in the area will be prohibited. Hiking, biking, and shoreline access by boat for recreation within 100 feet of the shoreline will remain available.']

title: ['Stage II Fire Restrictions']
description: ['Stage II Fire Restrictions will be in effect beginning Tuesday, January 21, 2025. Due to high fire danger, El Morro will implement Stage II Fire Restrictions. These include no campfires. No smoking except in an enclosed vehicle or other authorized area.']

title: ['Oversized Vehicles are Unable to Park in Visitor Center Parking Lot']
description: ['Due to construction, oversized vehicles will not be allowed to park in the visitor center parking lot due to lack of space and ability to turn-around safely. There is oversized parking along the main park road.']

title: ['Paces Mill Closed for Planned Rehabilitation Project']
description: ['Paces Mill will be closed until May 2025 with no access to parking, facilities, or the canoe launch. The last park boat ramp south of US-41 is open with limited, non-parking vehicle access for take-out. Plan to exit the river before Paces!']

title: ['Hurricane Ridge Road Status', 'N Shore Rd & S Shore Rd - 4/10/25', 'Hoh Rain Forest Area Closed- will reopen when county road is repaired']
description: ['Hurricane Ridge Road is OPEN. During the month of April, Hurricane Ridge Road may open or close depending on road conditions, weather, and staffing. Check back here or call 360-565-3131 for updates.', 'Crews installed a bridge on N Shore Rd, restoring access to Graves Creek. The next N Shore Rd construction project may close a section of road July 9 - Sept 15, 2025. S Shore Rd - which is maintained by Jefferson County - washed out in a winter storm.', 'Olympic National Park will begin restoring essential services to the Hoh Rain Forest once the Upper Hoh Road, which is maintained by Jefferson County, is safe for travel. Until then, the area is closed to all traffic, including pedestrians & bicycles.']

title: ['Trail update 1/24/2025']
description: ['Most trails are open and ready for the public. Those that remain closed are the Charleston Road/ Goudey Trail past the Cherokee Path and the portion of Cherokee Path between the stockade fort and the Charleston Road.']

title: ['Vehicle Length & Trailer Restrictions']
description: ['No large vehicle turnaround after Faraway Ranch Parking Lot (1 mile after entrance). Vehicles over 29 feet park at Faraway. Disconnect trailers at Faraway. Trailers with campground reservations proceed directly to camp.']

park: Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site
title: ['8 Miles of Unpaved Road to Reach Park']
description: ['In order to reach the Sand Creek Massacre NHS, you must travel on at least 8 miles of unpaved roads. We are not able to guarantee road conditions of county roads 54 or W after spring storms.']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins: Take precautions to secure your vehicle and valuables.']
description: ["This is an urban park. Don't hide valuables inside your car. Carry items with you on hike. Lock your vehicle and set car alarm. Recent auto break-ins at Rinconada Canyon parking lot. Report suspicious persons loitering/peeking in cars. Call 928-638-7805"]

title: ['Closures Due to Flood Damage', 'High Fire Danger']
description: ['Some areas of the park including Walnut Canyon Desert Drive and some trails remain closed after extensive flood damage. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open.', 'Due to high fire danger, there are multiple closures and prohibited activities. The main park road to Carlsbad Cavern and the visitor center is open.']

title: ['3/19/2025 Closure update for Chisha Foka Multi-Use trail rehabilitation']
description: ['All of the trail north of Old Canton Road is open. The Choctaw Agency parking lot is closed and contractors are working on the sections of trail adjacent to it.']

title: ['Howland Hill Road: Maintenance Closure']
description: ['Due to road grading, Howland Hill Road will be closed from April 14-24 (excluding weekends) to all uses including non-motorized vehicles. Access to the outdoor school is open to only school groups.']

title: ['Crescent Meadow Road and Moro Rock Loop Road Closed For the Season', 'Several Small Roads Closed Due to Roadway Damage Or Snow Accumulation', 'Highway 180 Access To Cedar Grove Area of Kings Canyon National Park Closed For the Season', 'Mineral King Road Is Closed For the Season']
description: ['The roads are closed to vehicle traffic for the winter season, but remain open to winter recreation such as hiking, snowshoeing, and cross-country skiing. Roads will reopen once they have been cleared and made safe for vehicle traffic.', 'These roads are closed due to roadway damage during past storm events or due to snow accumulation: Crystal Cave Rd, Middle Fork Rd, Redwood Canyon Rd, South Fork Rd, Panoramic Point Rd, lower parking lot at Giant Forest Museum', 'Highway 180 is closed east of Hume Lake Road for the winter season. Cedar Grove is not accessible. This section of road typically reopens in late April.', 'The portion of Mineral King Road inside Sequoia National Park is closed for the winter season to the general public. The road typically reopens in May on the Wednesday before Memorial Day, but could be later depending on conditions.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Crescent Meadow Road and Moro Rock Loop Road Temporary Closure', 'id': '54962ED2-C44A-43E6-9B3B-87B60352FC2E', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Road Closures Related to Past Storm Events and Snow Accumulation', 'id': '667EE370-7B7C-4A64-85CA-051F5C27F309', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Highway 180 Seasonal Closure', 'id': '02698AFD-CAAE-434F-8312-C023124680DA', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Mineral King Road Seasonal Closure', 'id': '5096154A-71A4-4F51-A7F8-98E102608092', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Winter Road Closures', 'Miners River Bridge Closed']
description: ['Sand Point Road is the only road maintained by the park in the winter. All other park roads, including Miners Castle Road and Chapel Road are not plowed within the park boundary.', 'The bridge connecting Miners Castle Road to Miners Beach is closed for a full bridge replacement. Closures will go through spring 2025.']

title: ['North Union Avenue and Grant Circle Closed for Repairs', 'Adjustments to USS Cairo Museum and Visitor Center Days of Operation', 'National Cemetery Closed to Vehicles; Open to Pedestrians', 'Louisiana Circle Closed']
description: ['North Union Avenue and Grant Circle are closed to vehicular and pedestrian traffic for repairs. Entering these construction areas is prohibited. This work is to repair severe weather damage in 2020. The remainder of the park and tour road are open.', 'Starting October 2, 2024, the USS Cairo Museum will be open 7 days a week and the Visitor Center will be open Wednesday-Sunday. The park grounds, fee booth, Visitor Center restrooms, and tour road will remain open seven days a week.', 'Due to weather related incidents, Vicksburg National Cemetery is closed to vehicular traffic, however it is open to pedestrians. Visitor can park in the adjacent USS Cairo parking lot and walk into the cemetery.', 'Louisiana Circle is closed to vehicles and pedestrians due to slope instability. Navy Circle is open and also provides views of the Mississippi River.']

title: ['Trail Conditions']
description: ['Trail conditions can vary throughout the state. Before heading out, check the trail conditions, potential re-routes and closures on the Ice Age Trail Alliance website.']

title: ['No vehicle access or parking']
description: ['Wednesday, 4/16 No vehicle access or parking allowed on the following roads. Pedestrian access will be maintained where sidewalks are present: - Hay Road - Andes Road West - Ferry Line Road - Soissons Landing West']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins']
description: ["Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity."]

title: ['Passaic River Trail Bridge washed out']
description: ["Tropical Storm Ida washed out the Passaic River bridge on the Patriot's Path Trail south of Tempe Wick Road. This area is a known habitat of the endangered wood turtle, so do not wade, walk, or let your dog run in the river at this location."]

title: ['Expect long lines to enter the park']
description: ['Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.']

title: ['Flooding/bridge out on the Grand Portage Trail at Poplar Creek']
description: ['Increased rain and beaver dam activity flooded the Poplar Creek Crossing along the Grand Portage Trail, washing out the bridge. Please use caution as you pass. Park staff is in the process of determining a route less prone to flood damage.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Tour Road Closed']
description: ['Due to safety hazards caused by tornado damage the tour road and nature trail are closed. The visitor center is now open.']

title: ['Seasonal closure of certain areas to prevent poaching']
description: ['The floodplain forest between the Connecticut River and NH Route 12A, north of the Blow-Me-Down Brook and forested areas on either side of Saint-Gaudens Road are closed to prevent damage from fiddlehead poaching during the months of April and May.']

title: ['Volcano Road Closed to RVs and Buses over 26 feet, and to all Trailers.']
description: ['The Volcano top road is not accessible to RVs, buses, attached trailers, or any other vehicle over 26 feet in length, due to the narrowness and weight limits of Volcano Road. Trailer drop off and RV/bus parking is available at the Visitor Center.']

title: ['Construction on State Highway ZZ, Farm Road 182 and other highways']
description: ['Be aware of ongoing construction on approach routes to the park. Roads may be closed for repaving, striping, and other reasons during spring, summer, and fall. Follow signs for detours.']

title: ['Most Park Roads Closed to All Vehicles', 'Vehicle entrance reservation not needed']
description: ['Spring plowing has begun and most roads are closed to all vehicles until mid-April. The road between the North and Northeast entrances remains open and is open year-round to regular vehicles.', 'Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.']

title: ['NPS 300 Road Conditions']
description: ['NPS 300 to Big Tubes is wet and muddy following the recent storms. A high clearance, four-wheel drive vehicle is required. You are responsible for removing a stuck vehicle.']

title: ['Service Road Closure']
description: ['The walkway toward the lighthouse is closed to due construction of the roadway. Please do not enter the area.']

title: ['Fort Donelson NB Road Access on Spring Schedule Beginning Sunday March 9, 2025']
description: ['From March 9 through May 25, 2025, vehicles may access park roads from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm for the Spring season. Pedestrian Access remains from sunrise to sunset.']

park: Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site
title: ['GPS Navigation Systems']
description: ["GPS navigation systems often misdirect visitors driving to Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site. GPS systems often route visitors to our back gate, or to the entrance for Grant's Farm (not affiliated with the NPS). Please visit our directions page."]

title: ['Downed Trees on Trails']
description: ['Please be cautions on all trails and side roads as high winds and heavy snow have caused several downed trees throughout the park.']

title: ['U.S. Navy Blue Angels Practices']
description: ['On Tuesdays and Wednesdays from April to October, parking lots at Fort Pickens Area fill early. Vehicles parked in non-designated spots are subject to citation and towing. When lots are full, the area will close to incoming traffic. Plan ahead.']

title: ['Starting April 15, ongoing road repair on Tuesdays and Wednesdays']
description: ['As of April 15, 2025, on Tuesdays & Wednesdays, road repair will be in effect . Please yield to construction traffic. Expect delays and uneven terrain. Bicycles and pedestrian traffic during this time is NOT recommended. Call visitor center with questions']

title: ['Warning about GPS Systems!']
description: ['Vehicle Navigation Systems and GPS units may provide inaccurate information—sending drivers the wrong way on one-way roads, leading them to dead ends in remote areas, or sending them on roads which are impassable. Use the Interstate exits for wayfinding.']

title: ['Quarry Exhibit Hall Temporary Closure in Fall 2025']
description: ['The Quarry Exhibit Hall with the "Wall of Bones" will be temporarily closed from September 8, 2025, to late October 2025 for a major road, parking lot, and sidewalk reconstruction project. There will be no visitor access to the fossils in the building.']

park: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site
title: ['Main Parking Lot and Front Lake Trail Closed']
description: ["The Main Parking Lot, restrooms and front lake trail are closed due to impacts from Hurricane Helene. Access the Hiker's Parking Lot at 1924 Little River Road, limited to 24 spaces. Porta-toilets, trail maps, and park brochures available at this location."]

title: ['Backcountry vehicle route closed for the season']
description: ['The backcountry vehicle route has closed for the season until May 15, 2025. As conditions allow, the route will be maintained as a groomed ski and snowshoe trail from the Cabin District to the horse barn near Cerro Piñon.']

title: ['Use Caution with GPS Navigation']
description: ['The new visitor center is located at 17970 US Hwy 30, about one mile north of downtown Hagerman and the old visitor center. Highway signs and GPS navigation may not yet be up-to-date.']

title: ['Paradise Road Status: Road opened, weather dependent.', 'SR165 Carbon River/Fairfax Bridge closed until further notice: no access to Carbon River.', 'Many park roads are closed for the winter season.', 'All vehicles are required to carry tire chains Nov 1 - May 1 when traveling in the park.']
description: ['Regular nightly closure of the gate to Paradise at Longmire has ended for the season. The road can still close at any time due to weather/road conditions. All vehicles are still required to carry tire chains until May 1.', 'Until further notice, there is NO access to Carbon River & Mowich Lake due to the closure of the SR165 Carbon River Fairfax Bridge outside of the park. The bridge is closed to pedestrians as well as vehicles and there is no alternate route.', 'Many park roads are closed for the winter season, including White River, Sunrise, Stevens Canyon, Westside Road, and SR410/123.', 'All vehicles, including 4WD and AWD vehicles, must carry tire chains in the park during the winter season (November 1 - May 1) and be prepared to use them when tire chain requirements are posted.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[], [{'title': 'SR165 Carbon River/Fairfax Bridge Closed', 'id': '27D5FB15-B9FB-4556-B1A7-F320827F9B3E', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/mora/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Closed for the Winter Season', 'id': '6E7D1A9C-253E-4183-9AAE-DED7F391C64B', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/mora/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], []]

title: ['Part of Scenic Drive Closed on Tuesday-Thursday (April 15-17). Detours are available.', 'Loose Gravel and Large Vehicles on Scenic Drive', 'Playground in Pine Grove Picnic Area Closed']
description: ['Due to construction work from 4-15 to 4-17, Scenic Drive will be closed to all public motor vehicle, bicycle, and pedestrian travel from the Park Entrance Road intersection to approximately Mile Marker 1. Detours are available on Joplin Road.', 'On a section of Scenic Drive near Cabin Camp 3 where a culvert under the road was replaced, there is compacted gravel across both lanes of travel. Use caution and follow posted speed limits. Be aware of constructions vehicles on the roadway.', 'The park is improving accessibility at the playground in Pine Grove Picnic Area. During construction, until approximately the end of June 2025, the playground is closed and 10 nearby parking spaces will be used for construction vehicles only.']

title: ['Bunker Hill Lodge Closure']
description: ['Bunker Hill Lodge is getting a fresh coat of paint to prepare for the 250th commemoration. The entrance to the Bunker Hill Monument will be temporarily re-routed through the iron gate surrounding the Monument. The Monument will maintain current hours.']

title: ['Portions of Braddock Road Trail Closed']
description: ['Portions of the Braddock Road Trail at the Indian Run bridge are closed until a new foot bridge is constructed.']

title: ['State Route 148 closed for the winter season']
description: ['Visitors can access the park via Highway 143 and the town of Brian Head. You can view Cedar Breaks from the North View Overlook. State Route 143 will remain open, weather permitting.']

title: ['Highway 12 Detour until Spring of 2025']
description: ['The Minnechaduza Creek Bridge is currently closed for replacement. Traffic is detoured around the bridge using county road 906th. This impacts river visitors. Please contact Niobrara NSR staff for more information at 402-389-1925.']

title: ['Use Caution on Roads with Debris', 'Most Monument Roads Require Heavy Duty 4WD Vehicle to Travel Safely']
description: ['Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.', 'Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.']

title: ['Hozomeen Gate Remains Closed', 'State Route 20 Closed for the Season', 'Cascade River Road Seasonal Closure', 'Be Aware of Break-ins along State Route 20']
description: ['Until further notice, the gate at Hozomeen will remain closed; vehicle and foot traffic across the US/Canada border is prohibited. Visitors must enter through a designated port of entry.', 'State Route 20 is closed at milepost 134 (Ross Dam Trailhead) for the season due to heavy snowfall and risk of avalanche danger. Check the WSDOT real time map for up-to-date information, https://wsdot.com/Travel/Real-time/Map/.', 'Cascade River Road is closed for the season at Eldorado (milepost 20). Check the road conditions page for more information.', 'Prevent smashed windows and theft. Break-ins are not uncommon at trailheads along State Route 20. Remove your valuables and electronics and take associated electronic cords.']

park: Fredericksburg and Spotsylvania County Battlefields Memorial National Military Park
title: ['Road Repair Project Ongoing']
description: ['Through the month of May, park maintenance staff will be working to repair and resurface roads. You may experience delays due to this work while driving in the park.']

title: ['River Trail periodically closed under I-16']
description: ['The section of the River Trail beneath Interstate 16 is closed during bridge construction when pedestrian safety is at risk and remains open when no significant hazards are present.']

park: Fort Sumter and Fort Moultrie National Historical Park
title: ['Fort Moultrie Fishing Dock Closure']
description: ['The Fort Moultrie Fishing Dock, Picnic Area, and Bench by the Road memorial are inaccessible until spring of 2026 due to a dock replacement project. An alternate picnic area along the sidewalk toward the General Moultrie Grave has been established.']

title: ['Navigation']
description: ['Do not rely on GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Badlands National Park. Please note that the Visitor Center at 25216 Ben Reifel Road, Interior SD 57750 is located just off I-90.']

park: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park
title: ['Overlook Parking Lot Unavailable After Dark']
description: ["The park parking lot at 72 McBride Extension is open from dawn to dusk every day. Any vehicles left in the parking lot after dusk (i.e. sunset) are subject to towing at owner's expense."]

title: ['Due to flooding access points to Bluestone National Scenic River are closed']
description: ['All access points to the park are currently closed. The road through Bluestone State Park and the Lilly access are currently closed due to flooding. Parts of the Bluestone Turnpike Trail may be flooded.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Road to Exit Glacier Closed to Automobiles']
description: ['The Alaska Department of Transportation has closed Herman Leirer Road for winter. Therefore, the road to Exit Glacier under the National Park Service is closed as well. Reopening is typically in mid to late-May, with variation due snow and weather.']

title: ['Secure trash and food']
description: ['Pack it in, pack it out! There are no trash services in or around the monument. All food & trash must be secured inside a vehicle. Ravens routinely open zipped bags & tear into trash bags left outside or in the bed of a truck.']

title: ['Notice to travelers to National Cemetery']
description: ['Due to the narrow roadway & tight turn, RVs, mobile homes, charter buses, delivery trucks, or vehicles with trailers are prohibited from the crest of Monument Hill. Check for information about parking at the Visitor Center upon your arrival.']

park: New River Gorge National Park and Preserve
title: ['Cunard Road delays']
description: ['Cunard Road has been reopened. There is a section of one lane road with a traffic light. Through Memorial Day, expect delays of 3 to 5 minutes to get by this area.']

title: ['Rough and Damaged Roads']
description: ['Please drive slowly and exercise due caution when driving in Mojave National Preserve. Rough and damaged roads exist on both paved and unpaved roads. Watch for potholes.']

title: ['Box Canyon Day Use Area Closed']
description: ['Due to the recent illegal lighting of a fire in the trash bin, the theft of government signs, and the unauthorized movement of barricades to drive into an area closed to vehicle traffic, the metal gate at the upper end of Box Canyon has now been closed.']

title: ['Bugbee Road Closed']
description: ['Bugbee Road is closed due to road construction until mid or late May.']

title: ['Looking for a Grand Canyon view? A warning about mobile devices and map/navigation apps', 'Arizona Off-Highway Vehicle (OHV) Requirements for Residents and Non-residents.']
description: ['Map apps may direct you to Parashant if you search for directions to "Grand Canyon" due the canyon\'s name in both the national park and monument names. The national park has paved roads and services. Parashant has no services and rugged/remote conditions.', 'Off-highway vehicles (OHVs) are required by law to display a valid OHV decal to operate on public and state trust lands in Arizona. This includes “street legal” vehicles that meet these two requirements.']

title: ['Bridge Closure on Sunflower Road']
description: ['Big Sandy Creek Unit: The bridge over Big Sandy Creek on Sunflower Road is closed for construction.']

park: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve
title: ['Loop Road Partially Open to All Vehicles', 'Navigation']
description: ['The Loop Road is mostly OPEN to vehicles, but the turnoffs to the Caves Area and the Tree Molds Spur remain CLOSED to all vehicles as of 4/15/25. Icy patches persist at 6,000 ft so maintain caution when accessing the road and trails.', 'Please do not rely upon GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Craters of the Moon. Please note that the Visitor Center at 1266 Craters Loop Road is located just off U.S. Highway 20/26/93 and is not accessed via any unpaved roads.']

title: ['New Mexico Road Advisories']
description: ['The New Mexico Department of Transportation updates its map of road advisories regularly. Visitors are encouraged to look for any possible road advisories along their route of travel beforehand.']

title: ['Reds Meadow Road and Devils Postpile National Monument are closed for the season', 'Reds Meadow Road Access Restrictions in 2025']
description: ['Reds Meadow Road, which provides access to Devils Postpile National Monument, is closed for the season, with a planned reopening on July 3, 2025.', 'Reds Meadow Road and shuttle service, which provide access to Devils Postpile, will only be open Fridays–Sundays (and on Thursdays with one-hour delays in July and August). The road will tentatively open for the season on July 3 and close October 6, 2025.']

title: ['Miles Creston Road Project now open to traffic.', 'Hawk Creek Lane Restriction at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area']
description: ['Miles Creston from Highway 2 to Copenhaver Road is currently a gravel roadway but will be hard surfaced in the late spring of 2025. Miles Creston is a main access to Lincoln Mill, Hawk Creek, and Seven Bays.', 'Due to undercutting action of Hawk Creek on the access road between the Hawk Creek campground and boat launch, the road will be reduced to one lane until further notice. Use caution while on this road.']

park: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area
title: ['Trail Alert: Cheeseboro Canyon Maintenance on Ranch Center Road']
description: ['Cheeseboro Canyon maintenance from March 17 – May 30, 2025, on Ranch Center Rd. will have large vehicles/heavy equipment. Trail closed: Weekdays from 8 AM to 5 PM. Open: Evenings and weekends. Work may be extended to late June if delayed by weather.']

title: ['Park Entrance Status']
description: ['The park has reopened to vehicles, though parking is limited. Board free Park Shuttle in Bryce Canyon City or utilize Shared-use Path to reduce congestion.']

title: ['Route 7 from Sawmill, AZ is NOT recommended']
description: ['Entering the park from the east at Sawmill, AZ on Route 7 is not recommended. Part of this route is UNPAVED and UNMAINTAINED. Please stay on paved roads, such as Indian Route 64 from Tsaile, AZ and Highway 191/Route 7 from Chinle, AZ.']

title: ['Closure on Joyce Road NW for bridge replacement']
description: ['Joyce Road NW is closed from the entrance of Rock Creek Park Golf Course to Missouri Ave NW while the bridge over Luzon Branch is replaced. Detours will be in place during the closure period.']

title: ['Mauna Loa Road closed to vehicles']
description: ['No public vehicle access on Mauna Loa Road from 6:00\u202fp.m. April 18 to 6:00\u202fp.m. April 27. The road is open to hiking and biking only.']

title: ['The Use of GPS is NOT Recommended']
description: ['Numerous visitors have been routed to remote trailheads and out-of-the-way roads trying to use GPS to reach the main park area or shuttle stop.']

title: ['Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail Closure along George Washington Memorial Parkway', 'Some facilities closed along the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail']
description: ['There is a temporary closure of the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge due to construction along the George Washington Memorial Parkway. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.', 'Please see our partner sites to find the most up-to-date information on closures, re-routes, or conditions along the Trail.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can help prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots. Before leaving your car to catch the ferry: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday']
description: ['County Line Road is closed during the week, from Monday through Friday. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.']

title: ['Dipsea Trail Footbridge Closed for Season', 'Parking Reservations Always Required - See "Know Before You Go" for Details', 'Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['The Dipsea Trail footbridge crossing Redwood Creek has been removed for the season. Please detour via the Deer Park Fire Road and Muir Woods Road. This closure does not impact the main trails in Muir Woods.', 'Reservations are required for all personal vehicles and shuttle riders at Muir Woods. You can make your reservation by visiting www.gomuirwoods.com. Visit our "Know Before You Go" webpage to learn more important details before your visit.', 'You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Mud Canyon Road closed 3/24 - 4/19', 'Emigrant Canyon Rd/Wildrose Area Closed Jan 6- Apr 19']
description: ['Mud Canyon Road will be closed 3/24 - 4/19 for repairs. Access to Beatty, NV and Daylight Pass Road is still open via Beatty Cut-Off Road.', 'Emigrant Canyon Road is temporarily closed for repair work to minimize future flood damage. No access to: Wildrose Charcoal Kilns, campgrounds (Wildrose, Thorndike and Mahogany Flat), trails (Wildrose and Telescope Peak) or dirt sideroads.']

title: ['Roosevelt Campobello International Park is located in Welshpool.']
description: ['Campobello Island is located in the province of New Brunswick, Canada. The physical address for the Visitor Centre is: 459 Route 774 Welshpool, New Brunswick, Canada E5E 1A4']

title: ['Jamestown Island Loop Roads Closed', 'Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Due to repairs taking place, The Jamestown Island Loop Drive is closed to all visitors, including pedestrians, cyclists, and vehicle traffic. The Island Loop Drive will reopen when it is safe to do so, likely in the Spring of 2025.', 'Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

park: Fort McHenry National Monument and Historic Shrine
title: ['Preservation Work Along Trails', 'Motorized Recreational Scooters Not Permitted in Park']
description: ['Starting March 18, preservationists restoring the bronze state plaques along the entrance road, and the War of 1812 commemorative markers in the Orpheus Grove. Some of these areas may be temporarily closed while work is in progress.', 'For the safety and protection of visitors and park resources, motorized scooters are not permitted within the park. Any vehicles (scooters, bicycles, etc.) that are part of a ride-share program may not be left behind for pick up inside the park']

title: ['Historic carriage roads closed until further notice for "mud season"', 'Several trails closed for Peregrine falcon nesting season']
description: ['Spring thaw has led to temporary closures to protect Acadia\'s historic carriage roads during "mud season." Walking, bicycling or riding horses in these wet and soft conditions can cause costly ruts and potholes that channel water and exacerbate erosion.', 'Until further notice, typically mid-August, Penobscot East Trail, Jordan Cliffs Trail, Precipice Trail, and Valley Cove Trail are closed for Peregrine falcon nesting season. Also, as roads reopen, the Precipice Trail parking lot will remain closed.']

title: ['VA North OSV Closure']
description: ['The Virginia North OSV zone is closed due to road construction & will remain closed until construction is completed. For more information regarding this project please visit Beach Relocation and Habitat Restoration Projects | U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service']

title: ['Portion of Kekaulike Avenue in Kula to close for approximately nine months', 'Drive Cautiously - Endangered Birds on Roadway']
description: ['A portion of Kekaulike Avenue (Route 377) between Waiakoa Road and ʻAlae Road will be closed for 24 hours, seven days a week, for approximately nine months.', 'Nēnē (Hawaiian geese) and ʻuaʻu (Hawaiian petrel) are nesting in the park and may land on or frequent park roads, parking lots, and road leading up to the park. Drivers are reminded to drive at the posted speed limits and exercise caution.']

park: Upper Delaware Scenic and Recreational River
title: ['Partial River Closure at Interstate Bridge No. 7 at Callicoon, NY']
description: ['A partial river closure is in effect at the Interstate Bridge No. 7 at Callicoon, NY due to the construction of a causeway extending into the main channel of the river. Please use caution and be aware of potentially hazardous conditions.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

park: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site
title: ['A Short Walk is Required to Reach the Fort']
description: ["A 1/4 mile (1,275 feet) walk on a paved trail from the parking area is required to reach the gate of the fort. At the end of your visit, you'll return to your vehicle along the same path."]

title: ['Many Glacier Construction Closure', 'Going-to-the-Sun Road Seasonal Closure']
description: ['Due to extremely limited parking during construction in the Swiftcurrent area, personal vehicle access into Many Glacier will be restricted from July 1-September 21, 2025. A temporary shuttle service will be provided for hikers wanting to access the area.', 'The Going-to-the-Sun Road is closed for the season at Lake McDonald Lodge on the west side and 1.5 miles west of St. Mary Visitor Center on the east side. Winter weather may change these locations at any time.']

title: ['Lassen National Park Highway Closed']
description: ['The main park road (Hwy 89) is closed at Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center (southwest entrance) and Loomis Plaza/Manzanita Lake (northwest entrance) to vehicles.']

title: ['Northwest Perimeter Road Open']
description: ['Northwest Perimeter Road is now accessible to visitors. Extensive cleanup and restoration efforts have been made following the EF 3 tornado that occurred on 4/27/2024. Please exercise good judgment and caution when driving or hiking through this area.']

title: ['Click on "view all alerts" below for important details on accessing the park', 'Pa-Hay-Okee Overlook Trail closed for replacement project until Fall 2025', 'Roadwork may cause delays on US 41/Tamiami Trail']
description: ['Construction on Tamiami Trail may cause minor delays. If you have a scheduled tour, please plan accordingly. Smoke impacts from park wildfires are possible along Main Park Road. Please use caution.', 'The Pa-Hay-Okee boardwalk trail, tower and parking lot will be closed for a replacement project until the fall. This is to replace aging infrastructure. The road remains open as a turnaround.', "Current roadwork is ongoing along the park's northern boundary on US Highway 41/Tamiami Trail to raise the road for Everglades Restoration benefits. Drivers may experience up to 15-minute delays and should watch for personnel, equipment and slow downs."]

park: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park
title: ['Hiking in Gold Mine Tract']
description: ['Visitors are restricted to the designated trails within the Gold Mine Tract in the Great Falls area. This location is generally defined as that area bordered by MacArthur Boulevard and Berma Road and depicted on the Great Falls Maryland Hiking Map.']

title: ['Warning: HIGH VISITATION 3/1-5/26. Please Read ALERT in Full']
description: ['During High Visitation, Expect LONG LINES and LIMITED PARKING. RVS and Trailers should use overflow parking along road or unhitch before visiting. Busses should drop off passengers ONLY. Please pay online before visit and have passes/IDs ready.']

title: ['Road Open To: Mile 13 (Mountain Vista)', 'Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide']
description: ['The Denali Park Road is open to Mile 13, Mountain Vista. Wintry conditions beyond that point prevent vehicle travel, though pedestrian travel is permitted.', 'Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.']

title: ['Dunes Drive Safety Corridor', 'Park Closures', 'RV and Tractor Trailer Parking at the Visitor Center']
description: ['Dunes Drive is open. A safety corridor is in effect between mile marker 3 and 5.5 along Dunes Drive. Visitors may drive but not stop or exit their vehicle in this area.', 'From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.', 'There is limited space for parking for recreational vehicles and trailers in the parking lot directly in front (south) of the visitor center. RVs are asked to not park in the lot behind the visitor center. There is no parking space for tractor trailers.']

title: ['Annual/Seasonal Canyon Closures', 'Scenic Drive Rehabilitation Project']
description: ['The following are closed to entry through 8/31/2025 to protect sensitive resources: Headquarters Canyon, the heads of Burro Wash & Fivemile Wash descending east 2 miles, Shinob Canyon + routes descending into Shinob, including Na-gah, Nighthawk, & Timpie.', 'The Scenic Drive is open through Capitol Gorge. Please drive carefully in construction areas. The road will fully close again--likely sometime in April (dates are unknown at this time as the asphalt work is temperature-dependent). Check back for updates.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Prescribed Burn Taking Place Tuesday, April 15', 'Trail Ridge Road is Closed to Through Travel for the Season']
description: ['Fire managers are conducting a prescribed burn near Beaver Meadows Visitor Center. US 36 from Beaver Meadows Visitor Center to Bear Lake Road junction is closed from 10-2. Use US 34/Fall River Entrance.', 'Trail Ridge Road (U.S. Hwy 34) is closed to vehicles to through travel for the season. Trail Ridge Road is closed on the east side of the park at Many Parks Curve and on the west side of the park at Colorado River Trailhead.']

title: ['Temporary Road Closures can Occur in Winter']
description: ['While the majority of park roads remain open, these three sometimes temporarily close to vehicles due to winter weather: Crystal Creek Road, Mill Creek Road, and Peltier Valley Road from Brandy Creek Road.']

title: ['Bringing a Pet to Big Bend?']
description: ['Bringing your pet to Big Bend National Park will limit some of your park explorations and opportunities. Pets are not allowed on park trails, in the backcountry, or on the river. Pets are allowed only where vehicles can go. Pets may not be left unattended']

title: ['South Unit Road from the Old East Entrance station mile near marker 22 to mile marker 28']
description: ['Due to major road repair work, the former scenic loop between the Old East Entrance Station (near mile marker 22) and mile marker 28 is closed to all traffic, including pedestrian, and bicycle access.']

title: ['All East Side Trails Closed April 15th for Prescribed Fire', 'Bottomland Nature Trail Will be Closed Starting September 3rd', 'Dangerous Highway Crossing']
description: ['Two Section, Fox Creek, and Bottomland Area trails east of the visitor center Hwy 177 are closed. All trails west of Highway 177 are open. Access west side trails from the visitor center or historic ranch area. For your safety, do not cross posted signs', 'The Bottomland Nature Trail will be closed beginning September 3rd for the trail resurfacing project. It will remain closed until work is complete. Fox Creek Trail remains open, but can only be accessed from the north through the under highway crossing.', 'Highway 177 is 60 mph with a blind spot directly across from the house. Safely use the highway underpass to the Fox Creek Trail just south of the visitor center parking lot. Be smart, stay alive.']
